title: Observability for HTTP Server - when http route is / then attribute 'http.route' is not sent
body:
### Describe the bug

HTTP Server span does not contain required attribute named `http.route` in case the route is `/` only
seeing it for reactive routes, but maybe it happens on non-reactive as well

### Expected behavior

according to [OTEL semantic conventions of HTTP Server](https://opentelemetry.io/docs/specs/otel/trace/semantic_conventions/http/#http-server-semantic-conventions) the attribute `http.route` is required

### Actual behavior

the attribute `http.route` is not set , when the server route is `/` only

### How to Reproduce?

1) I open the application reactive-routes-quickstart from quickstarts:
https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus-quickstarts/tree/main/reactive-routes-quickstart

2) I added OpenTelemetry dependency for observabilty
```
        <dependency>
            <groupId>io.quarkus</groupId>
            <artifactId>quarkus-opentelemetry</artifactId>
        </dependency>
```

3) I ran the application

4) I browsed to http://localhost:8080/ and got "hello"
I see the trace (via Jaeger) and it missing attribute `http.route`

![image](https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/assets/104715391/d4a7352b-5a05-40ba-bacc-f278e0c0f0ad)

5) I browsed to http://localhost:8080/hello?name=john and got "hello jon"
I see the trace and it has attribute `http.route`

![image](https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/assets/104715391/83c3b388-cf0e-4eb3-824b-88f2621f2bc7)
